shortdesc.ph: Used to configure the media file to be played and the playback scenario.
Used to configure the media file to be played and the playback scenario.

plentry.pd: URL of the media file to be played. If opening a regular media resource, pass url. If opening a custom media resource, pass provider. Agora recommends not passing both parameters in a single call, otherwise the call may fail.
URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) of the media file.
Start position of playback (in milliseconds). Default is 0.

pd.note: If auto play is disabled, you need to call the method after opening the media file.
pd.ph: Whether to automatically play after opening the media file:

pd.note: Agora only supports caching of on-demand audio and video streams that are not transmitted via HLS protocol. To enable caching, pass uri; otherwise, caching is based on the media file's url. Once enabled, the media player will cache part of the media file locally during playback, allowing playback even without a network connection. Cache statistics are updated every second after playback. See .
pd.ph: Whether to enable caching when playing media files:

pd.note: If you need to set different audio tracks for local playback and publishing to the channel, set this parameter to , then call the method to select the track.
pd.ph: Whether to allow selecting different audio tracks when playing the media file:

ul.li: : (default) Do not allow selecting different audio tracks.

pd.note: If you need to open a live stream or on-demand video distributed via Agora's ultra-low latency live streaming service, pass the media resource URL to url and set isAgoraSource to ; otherwise, you do not need to set this parameter.
pd.ph: Whether the media resource to be opened is a live stream or on-demand video distributed via Agora's ultra-low latency live streaming service:

ul.li: : The media resource is distributed via Agora's ultra-low latency live streaming service.
: (default) The media resource is not distributed via Agora's ultra-low latency live streaming service.

pd.note: If the media resource to be opened is a live stream, Agora recommends setting this parameter to to speed up live stream loading. If the media resource is not a live stream but isLiveSource is set to , loading speed will not be improved.
pd.ph: Whether the media resource to be opened is a live stream:

ul.li: : The media resource is a live stream.
: (default) The media resource is not a live stream.

plentry.pd: Callback for custom media resource files. See . If opening a custom media resource, pass provider. If opening a regular media resource, pass url. Agora recommends not passing both url and provider in a single call, otherwise the call may fail.

The URL of the media file to be played. If opening a regular media resource, pass in the value of url; if opening a custom media resource, pass in the value of provider. Agora recommends not passing values for both parameters in a single call, as it may cause the call to fail.
The URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) of the media file.
The position (in milliseconds) from which to start playback. Default is 0.

pd.note: If auto play is disabled, you need to manually call the method after opening the media file.
pd.ph: Whether to automatically play the media file after it is opened:

pd.note: Agora only supports caching on-demand audio and video streams that are not transmitted via the HLS protocol. To enable caching, assign a value to uri; otherwise, caching is based on url by default. When this feature is enabled, the Media Player caches the portion of the audio and video file being played to the local device, allowing playback without a network connection. Cache statistics are updated once per second after playback starts. See for details.
pd.ph: Whether to cache the media file during playback:

pd.note: If you need to set different audio tracks for local playback and publishing to the channel, set this parameter to , and then call the method to select the audio track.
pd.ph: Whether to allow selecting different audio tracks when playing media resources:

ul.li: : (default) Does not allow selecting different audio tracks.

pd.note: If you need to play a live or on-demand video distributed via the Ultra Low Latency Live service, pass the media resource's URL to url, and set isAgoraSource to ; otherwise, you do not need to set this parameter.
pd.ph: Whether the media resource is a live or on-demand video distributed via the Media Broadcast service:

pd.note: If opening a live stream, Agora recommends setting this parameter to to enable faster loading of the live stream. If the media resource is not a live stream but isLiveSource=true is set, it will not improve loading speed.
pd.ph: Whether the media resource is a live stream:

ul.li: : (default) It is not a live stream.

plentry.pd: Callback for providing data of custom media resource files. See . If opening a custom media resource, pass in the value of provider; if opening a regular media resource, pass in the value of url. Agora recommends not passing values for both url and provider in a single call, as it may cause the call to fail.
